result.execSummary:
The defendant Raimundo A Jones was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Apply 54 days sentence credit.
CORRECTED 01-15-2016:  Apply 50 days sentence credit.
Concurrent with: Case 13CF553.

superMiscConds.notes:
Cash bail applied to Court costs.  Balance to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.  Court waives DNA surcharge.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
ADOA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Case 13CF1052 is dismissed and read in.

supervisions.notes: Court will allow for transfer of Extended Supervision to the State of Illinois.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Kelly Pingel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Raimundo A Jones in court, in custody.   
Atty. Sonderhouse appeared as friend of the court.

Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.
Preliminary hearing waived, bound over.  
Information filed, reading waived.


Defendant enters a plea of No Contest to the charge.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of the charge.


Court orders the following:
Total Prison: 3 Years.
Initial Confinement: 1 Year.
Extended Supervision: 2 Years.
54 Day Credit.
Concurrent to:  Case:  13CF553
  
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
Court will allow for transfer of E.S. to the State of Illinios.
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).


Costs:  $268
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  Court Waives
Apply Bail to case 13CF553 First then to this case.
Balance to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.    



Defendant to be transferred to DCI - FORTHWITH.

Defendant Raimundo A Jones in court, in custody, with attorney Adam J. Schleis.  Attorney appears as friend of the court. Mary C. Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for December 3, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
